    • Method Detail

      • immediateCost

        public double immediateCost(examples.jmdp.Distance i,
                   examples.jmdp.SpiderAction a)
        This method is easy to design, the immediate reward is directly associated with the incurred action, in that way, you have to associate a reward with the action taken. However, you can discriminate by states, It is very IMPORTANT: Associate a zero immediate reward to terminal state f.
        Specified by:
        immediateCost in class DTMDP<examples.jmdp.Distance,examples.jmdp.SpiderAction>
        Parameters:
        i - Current State
        a - Current Action
        Returns:
        The immediate reward o cost associate with an action and a state.
        See Also:
        DTMDP.immediateCost(State, Action)

      • feasibleActions

        public Actions<examples.jmdp.SpiderAction> feasibleActions(examples.jmdp.Distance i)
        This method return all possible action which could be taken from a StateC i, it is preferred that you create an action which makes the terminal state becomes an absorbing state. This action return a self-transition probability = 1.
        Specified by:
        feasibleActions in class InfiniteMDP<examples.jmdp.Distance,examples.jmdp.SpiderAction>
        Parameters:
        i - Current State
        Returns:
        set of Actions that can be taken at this state.
        See Also:
        InfiniteMDP.feasibleActions(State)
